comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: This is Edward Stanley, 17th Earl of Derby. He was a politician and soldier, especially effective at raising what he called "pal battalions" during World War I. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Stanley,_17th_Earl_of_Derby 1914-1918.invisionzone.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=137614

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Typo on the caption, the title on the print says Bat, not Cat.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: And Lord Derby's name is also mis-spelt.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content:
According to the invisionzone.com link from Cynthia Wenslow, these would have been dockworkers under military regulations.  An amusing anecdote from invisionzone:

"Someone whose father was in the battalion told me that once they were paraded and given a speech by the Earl of Derby when a voice from the ranks was heard: "He's got Knowsley Hall and we've got b*gger all". "

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for catching these transcription errors. We'll make the corrections the next time we update the record.
